summary: This document is an email chain from July 12, 2019, forwarding a tip to the FBI's New York office regarding a potential male victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The tip originates from an investigative journalist friend of the sender, who claims the victim has credible information about abuse, trafficking, and high-level government figures, including a former president. The email also references a deceased retired female cop and the murdered Arkansas State Senator Linda Collins-Smith in the context of child trafficking information.

persons.name: Linda Collins Smith
persons.context: Mentioned as having had contact with the email sender about a CPS corruption case and possessing information on child trafficking before her murder.

events.title: Tip forwarded to FBI NY regarding Epstein victim
events.description: An email is forwarded to the FBI's New York office regarding a credible male victim with information on Epstein's trafficking operation and high-level government figures.

events.title: Murder of Linda Collins-Smith
events.description: The murder of Arkansas State Senator Linda Collins-Smith is referenced; she was reportedly in possession of information on child trafficking.

keyFacts: A tip was forwarded to the FBI NY office on July 12, 2019, regarding a credible male victim of Jeffrey Epstein who allegedly has information on the entire trafficking process and specifics on high-level government people, including a former president.
The tip originated from an investigative journalist who was working with a now-deceased female retired cop on human trafficking cases.
The email sender references being in contact with the now-murdered Arkansas State Senator Linda Collins-Smith about a CPS corruption case and child trafficking information.
The FBI's victim intake process via 1-800-CALL-FBI is described, where calls are tracked and pushed to appropriate investigative teams.
